intro: Bladhia crispa f. xanthocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited bladhia, is a rare and striking plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow fruits, which set it apart from other members of the species. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
